title: pylifemap
text: pylifemap is a jupyter widget allowing to visualize taxonomy data on Lifemap.

title: pylifemap
text: pylifemap is a jupyter widget allowing to visualize taxonomy data on Lifemap.

title: pylifemap
text:
Installation and usage
For the moment the package can only be installed from Github:
pip install git+https://github.com/juba/pylifemap.git
Usage gives more detailed usage instructions.

title: pylifemap
text:
Credits

The iucn data files in the data/ directory have been generated from The IUCN Red List of Threatened Species dataset (DOI 10.15468/0qnb58).
Visualizations are powered by Open Layers and deck.gl.
The widget is developed thanks to the anywidget framework.
This documentation website is generated by Quarto and quartodoc.

title: Development
text:
To install pylifemap from git:
pip install git+https://github.com/juba/pylifemap.git

title: Development
text:
To install pylifemap from git:
pip install git+https://github.com/juba/pylifemap.git

title: Development
text:
Install fom source
If you want to build pylifemap from source, youâ€™ll have to follow these steps:

Install node.js
Install hatch dependency management system
Clone the pylifemap repository
Install Python dependencies with : hatch shell
Install JavaScript dependencies with : npm install --workspaces --include-root-workspace

title: Development
text:
Widget JavaScript modification and bundling
Each time the widget JavaScript or CSS code is modified in the src/js/ or packages/lifemapjs directories, it must be bundled with one of the following commands in pylifemap:
# Bundle only once
npm run bundle
# Or, to bundle and watch for code change
npm run dev
The result is put into src/pylifemap/static.

title: Development
text:
Maintenance notes

Releases

Change version in NEWS.md and src/pylifemap/__about__.py
Release the Python package with hatch build and hatch publish in pylifemap
Tag the version in git
Create a release on Github
Bump to dev version in pyproject.toml and NEWS.md
